programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: In an alternate 1980s, the United States stands alone as communism grows stronger. When Soviet soldiers invade a small Colorado town, brothers Jed (Patrick Swayze) and Matt Eckert (Charlie Sheen) escape with friends to the forest. With their father, Tom (Harry Dean Stanton), a prisoner of the invading army, the children decide to fight against the Soviets. As the country comes under increasing attack, the group teams up with Lt. Col. Andrew Tanner (Powers Boothe) to take back their town.

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
programme.desc: Charlie Lang (Nicolas Cage) is a simple, kindhearted New York City cop. When he realizes he has no money to tip waitress Yvonne Biasi (Bridget Fonda), Lang offers her half the winnings of his lottery ticket. Amazingly, the ticket happens to be a winner, in the sum of $4 million. True to his word, Lang proceeds to share the prize money with Biasi, which infuriates his greedy wife, Muriel (Rosie Perez). Not content with the arrangement, Muriel begins scheming to take all the money.

programme.title: Pretty in Pink
programme.desc: Andie (Molly Ringwald) is an outcast at her Chicago high school, hanging out either with her older boss (Annie Potts), who owns the record store where she works, or her quirky classmate Duckie (Jon Cryer), who has a crush on her. programme.desc: Writer-director Paul Haggis interweaves several connected stories about race, class, family and gender in Los Angeles in the aftermath of 9/11. Characters include a district attorney (Brendan Fraser) and his casually prejudiced wife (Sandra Bullock), dating police detectives Graham (Don Cheadle) and Ria (Jennifer Esposito), a victimized Middle Eastern store owner and a wealthy African-American couple (Terrence Dashon Howard, Thandie Newton) humiliated by a racist traffic cop (Matt Dillon).

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: The discovery that she has a terminal illness prompts introverted saleswoman Georgia Byrd (Queen Latifah) to reflect on what she realizes has been an overly cautious life. So Georgia withdraws her life savings and jets off to Europe where she lives like a millionaire. Upbeat and passionate, Georgia charms everybody she meets, including renowned Chef Didier (Gérard Depardieu). The only one missing from her new life is her longtime crush Sean Matthews (LL Cool J).

programme.title: The Wash
programme.desc: "The Wash" is an action-comedy starring Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre. As mismatched roommates working at a car wash, they come together to rescue their boss (George Wallace) from a couple of first-time kidnappers. If they don't settle their differences and get Mr. Washington back, the good times at "The Wash" will soon come to an end.

programme.title: Memphis

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Lena Younger (Phylicia Rashad) receives a settlement from her husband's life insurance policy and then must decide what to do with the money. She wants to move out of their apartment into a house in a more genteel neighborhood. Her eldest son, Walter (Sean Combs), aspires to be an entrepreneur. Daughter Beneatha (Sanaa Lathan) hopes to go to medical school. Though their aspirations collide, they try to find a way to retain their family's cohesion.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: Years after his squad was ambushed during the Gulf War, Major Ben Marco (Denzel Washington) finds himself having terrible nightmares. He begins to doubt that his fellow squad-mate Sergeant Raymond Shaw (Liev Schreiber), now a vice-presidential candidate, is the hero he remembers him being. As Marco's doubts deepen, Shaw's political power grows, and, when Marco finds a mysterious implant embedded in his back, the memory of what really happened begins to return.

programme.title: Blue Caprice
programme.desc: A man trains a teenager and turns him into a deadly sniper, then the duo embarks on a rampage across America.

programme.title: Shaft

programme.title: The Best of All the Smoke With Matt Barnes and Stephen Jackson

programme.title: Get Rich or Die Tryin'
programme.desc: After losing his mother to murder as a boy, Marcus (Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson) has little support in his life. He starts working for drug dealer Levar (Bill Duke) and his assistant (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje). Although Marcus makes good money selling, his dream is to become a rapper. When he reunites with an old love (Joy Bryant) and is later shot numerous times during a robbery, Marcus decides it's time to change his life. However, his old associates won't let him go so easily.

programme.title: Southside With You

programme.title: Rafiki
programme.desc: Kena and Ziki live very different lives in Nairobi. Kena works in her father's shop and awaits the start of nursing school, while Ziki passes the days hanging out with her friends and making up dance routines. Their paths cross when their fathers run against each other for seats in the County Assembly, and they find themselves drawn to each other. Soon their interest grows to affection and the girls find ways to love each other despite the ever-watching gaze of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Step Up Revolution
programme.desc: Newly arrived in Miami, young dancer Emily (Kathryn McCormick) dreams of becoming a professional. She soon meets and falls in love with Sean (Ryan Guzman), the leader of a dance crew called "the Mob." When a rich businessman's plans to develop the dancers' historic neighborhood threatens to displace thousands of people, Emily must join forces with Sean and the Mob to turn their performance art into protest art, even though doing so may place her dreams in jeopardy.

programme.title: Fear of a Black Hat
programme.desc: This mock documentary follows sociologist Nina Blackburn (Kasi Lemmons) during the year she spends studying hip-hop artists Ice Cold (Rusty Cundieff), Tasty-Taste (Larry B. Scott), Tone Def (Mark Christopher Lawrence) and a series of disappearing white managers. Every rap cliché is on display: sex, sexism, violent imagery and paint-peeling profanity -- all of it, the group insists, with a deeper political meaning -- plus the inevitable rivalry with other rappers and ultimately themselves.

programme.title: A Thousand Words
programme.desc: Jack McCall (Eddie Murphy) is a selfish literary agent whose fast-talking ways allow him to close any deal. His next target is New Age guru Dr. Sinja (Cliff Curtis), but the savvy doctor sees right through Jack. A magical tree appears in Jack's yard, and, according to Dr. Sinja, the tree and Jack are connected; every time Jack says a word, a leaf falls from the tree. When the last leaf drops, Jack will die. With just a thousand leaves left, Jack must learn to curb his speech or he's a goner.

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: Far from Chicago, hairdresser Gina Norris (Queen Latifah) has relocated to Atlanta with her daughter (Paige Hurd) and has quickly established herself as a rare talent in her profession. But after repeatedly butting heads with her shady, over-the-top boss, Jorge (Kevin Bacon), Norris sets out to create her own salon -- even snagging a few of Jorge's employees and clients, including Lynn (Alicia Silverstone) and Terri (Andie MacDowell), respectively. Now, Jorge will do anything to shut her down.

programme.title: Wild Birds Of Australia
programme.desc: Meet four bird species that go to exceptional lengths to find mates and raise their young. See how they protect their territory from invaders, attract the ideal mate, and safeguard their chicks to give them the best chance at life.

programme.title: Life's Journey
programme.desc: Young animals in Zambia face the great challenge of reaching maturity in order to breed, and every lesson learned could mean the difference between life and death. Coming of age for these creatures requires skill, strength, courage, and copious luck.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years' worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: Seasons of the Wild
programme.desc: Dry conditions and lower temperatures bring about significant changes to the Everglades. Predator and prey are forced to live in close proximity due to a limited supply of water. Some will thrive-and some will fight to survive.

programme.title: Seasons of the Wild
programme.desc: Warm temperatures and an abundance of food revive the Everglades as water floods the prairies, mangroves, and marshes. Many of the 600 animal species disperse during this time, expanding their hunting and breeding grounds.

programme.title: Life's Journey

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Trouble brews when the team makes the final attempt to reunite reluctant mother Dilla with her new baby Delilah. And Alba, the world's only known albino orangutan, amazes her friends with her unique approach to termite foraging.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Witness veterinarian Dr. Amanda Salb save an elephant calf caught in a poacher's snare, racing time to treat the wound. Back at the base, an orphaned baby baboon meets his new family. A monitor lizard and duiker are returned to freedom in the wild.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Some animals survive with a little help from their friends. Witness the ways buffalo, lions, hyenas, wild dogs, and even some birds work together to help each other protect their offspring, overcome predators, hunt, and defend their territory.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Explore a land of big horns, huge claws, flowing manes, and dance moves that could cut a dozen rugs. Smash skulls with bighorn rams, fight over lunch with a hungry bear, go hoof-to-hoof with wild stallions, and get a dance floor bloody with a grouse.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Referee savage battles for dominance from the Scottish Highlands to the Alps. Chase rivals with a bleating red deer buck, keep intruders at bay with a wolf pack, join a red fox's deadly dance, and steal a neighbour's home with a nasty alpine marmot.

programme.title: Seasons of the Wild

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted footage of two adorable twin baby tamarin monkeys sleeping, snuggling and watching the world around them with wide-eyed wonder. Animals in captivity filmed at Queensland Zoo.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Learn the clever ways animals avoid becoming a meal in a deadly land where everything is on the menu. Meet a fish designed to fail, fight crazed wildebeests, join a murderous mob of meerkats, and become a destructive force with a swarm of locusts.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Travel to a spectacular land full of violent animals. Observe giraffes wielding their long necks as weapons, grab a meal with nature's flying undertakers, feel the force of the deadliest kick in nature, and form alliances with ill-tempered chimps.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Safety is scarce in the Zambian wilderness, where predators hide in the shadows. With a bull hippo struck down in his prime, a young lion discovered in the bush, and a massive buffalo snuffed out in the mud, the chase is on to identify the culprit.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Join Tom and his team as they travel to some of the most remote and rarely visited volcanoes in Indonesia. Climb to the top of active volcanoes that are in a constant state of eruption, and see just how explosive these giant craters can be.

programme.title: Life's Journey
programme.desc: Life for animals is an epic struggle to pass on genes to the next generation and preserve their legacy. Only the strongest and most determined will find and fight for mates, and only the best parents will have the skills to keep their young alive.

programme.title: Africa's Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: Just off the east coast of South Africa lie two vastly different worlds. Follow the incredible journey of a hawksbill turtle as it navigates the dangerous and temperamental waters of Aliwal Shoal on its way to the vibrant coral paradise of Sodwana.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Join the vet and his team in saving a massive sea lion caught in a plastic noose, and then visit the Rescue Centre, where a harbour seal pup may lose its eyesight and a baby sea otter needs a risky but life-saving surgery.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: In Hampton, New Brunswick the deer population is running wild. In the summer locals struggle to maintain their crops from growing fawns and hungry does. Sightings have reached an all time high and residents fear the overpopulation may be at its tipping point.

programme.title: Animals At Play
programme.desc: Discover how recreation is more widespread across species than scientists thought. See predators get a mental workout as well as a physical one, and witness one of the first recorded examples of reptile play.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Uncover one of the biggest issues in African conservation: the growing human population. See how the battle for land creates unintended conflicts between humans and animals, and what Lewa staff do to cope in the short term.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Kenya takes a major step towards creating the country's first community-run rhino sanctuary. Find out why Lewa considers this the right move, and witness teams move rhinos from across the country to this new conservancy.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Follow Kenyan capture teams to the Somali border to catch 50 rare and endangered antelope that need to be relocated into a predator-free conservancy. With no roads and the two nations at war, the operation must be carried out by helicopter.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Winter in Marakele National Park is one of the scarcest, but also most plentiful, times of the year. See how a giraffe's demise becomes a source of life for the region's vultures, whose survival depends on the decaying flesh of animals like these.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Cape Town, South Africa is home to twenty types of frogs, but many are threatened by urban development. Meet a variety of the region's species as we follow western leopard toads on their tenuous journey to breed in the city's shrinking wetlands.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Once superabundant, African Elephant populations have declined drastically due to hunting. Get an in-depth look into the lives of the most powerful land mammals on the planet, and see what parks like Addo and Tembe are doing to preserve their future.

programme.title: Osprey: Sea Raptor
programme.desc: A veteran pair of osprey return home to a Connecticut saltmarsh. Over one summer they must battle their enemies, withstand the elements, and hunt hundreds and hundreds of fish, all to raise the next generation of sea raptors.

programme.title: After The Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia's catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: From the vast, dry plains of the interior come some of Australia's most recognized imagery, such as the monolithic red rock of Uluru and the bounding red kangaroo. But how did the arid centre of the continent come to be?

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: Created by titanic forces and spanning 3,700 km along the eastern edge of Australia, the Great Dividing Range separates two very different worlds. Aerial footage and intimate studies reveal how species survive and thrive in this mountain home.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons

programme.desc: Explore the verdant rainforest of the Western Ghats in southern India, where an endangered baby lion-tailed macaque will need to learn the laws of the jungle to survive food shortages, a shrinking habitat, and hungry predators.

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: From the vast, dry plains of the interior come some of Australia's most recognized imagery, such as the monolithic red rock of Uluru and the bounding red kangaroo. But how did the arid centre of the continent come to be?

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: Created by titanic forces and spanning 3,700 km along the eastern edge of Australia, the Great Dividing Range separates two very different worlds. Aerial footage and intimate studies reveal how species survive and thrive in this mountain home.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Brier Island is at the western point of the Bay of Fundy in Nova Scotia. And in the surrounding waters live an incredible number of humpback whales and dolphins. On still waters, Humpbacks smash their tails, flap their fins, and breach one en masse. It's an incredible sight. A pod of dolphins swims into the Bay of Fundy, feeding off herring. They're soon joined by an Orca that capitalizes on their feeding strategies.

programme.title: Animals At Play
programme.desc: Discover how species buddy up for group games with astonishing benefits. See how various animals, from young hyenas playing tug of war to mischievous monkeys getting rough and tumble, communicate the rules of their antics.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: In the cool highlands near Australia's Snowy Mountains is Wombat Wood. There, dotted amongst the trees and dense foliage, are over a hundred wombat burrows. But when some of the burrows are flooded, the wombats need to find safety.

programme.title: How Do They Do It? (S7)
programme.desc: How do investigators establish the cause of a fire; and why are oak barrels important in traditional French winemaking?

programme.title: How It's Made (S9)
programme.desc: Find out how Game Calls, Mayonnaise, Traditional Razor Blades, and Butterfly Safety Razors are made.
